books.title: Parnassus on Wheels
books.author: Christopher Morley
books.summary: 39-year-old Helen McGill—disgruntled with her life tending to her brother and his farm—becomes the unlikely owner of a traveling bookseller’s wagon, and travels across the New England countryside spreading love and the joy of reading.

books.title: Bellarion the Fortunate
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: An orphan develops his talents in intrigue, romance, and war in fifteenth-century Italy.

books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: The Water-Babies
books.author: Charles Kingsley
books.summary: A young, uneducated, and mistreated chimney sweep is reborn as a denizen of the fairy world, beginning a journey of moral and spiritual growth.

books.title: A Prefect’s Uncle
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s life at boarding school is disrupted by an uncle that he’s never met before.

books.title: Measure for Measure
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A duke pretends to leave Vienna so that he can observe his deputy’s management during his supposed absence.

books.title: The Road to Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl takes a passerby down the road near her farm when they find themselves transported to another land.

books.title: Jeeves Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring Jeeves and Wooster and the upperclass English life of the early 1900s.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: The Clue
books.author: Carolyn Wells
books.summary: A young woman is found dead under mysterious circumstances, and the discovery of a single but significant clue ends up uncovering more than anyone could have expected.

books.title: A Daughter of the Samurai
books.author: Etsu Inagaki Sugimoto
books.summary: The autobiography of Etsu Sugimoto, a girl born into a samurai family in a time of great cultural changes.

books.title: Leviathan
books.author: Thomas Hobbes
books.summary: Hobbes explores a vision of the ideal state, in which people cede certain freedoms to a sovereign power in exchange for security and stability.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Wilfred Owen
books.summary: A collection of Wilfred Owen’s published poems.

books.title: Those Barren Leaves
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.summary: An aristocrat summons a group of “intelligentsia” to vacation in her Italian mansion.

books.title: Pellucidar
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: An adventurer returns to the hollow interior of the Earth in search of his lost love.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A collection of Chekhov’s short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Tao Te Ching
books.author: Laozi
books.summary: One of the fundamental texts of the Tao philosophy and religion.

books.title: On a Chinese Screen
books.author: W. Somerset Maugham
books.summary: A collection of short vignettes about the people and places W. Somerset Maugham encountered during his travels along the Yangtze River in 1919–20.
